julirama723: I initially thought the same thing about myself in my 20s vs in my 30s... but then I realized that for me, it was actually more of an acceptance of who I truly am vs performative femininity to offset my fatness (which can be construed as masculinity.) I’m just saying that for me, it wasn’t authentic. You don’t owe anyone an apology for the fact that you’ve changed and you’re presenting yourself differently to the world.
